body: r_c bends over the body of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} beloved, wailing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} despair into m_c's fur. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/sit/sits} vigil next to the body, wishing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} could wake from this nightmare.

r_c stares dully at m_c, the world fading from awareness as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/try/tries} to comprehend {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} death. All the things they'll never do together, the places r_c wanted to show {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, the life they could have lived by each other's sides, all wiped away in an instant.
r_c is inconsolable at the news of m_c's death, howling {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grief to the stars even as {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates try to support and comfort {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

r_c stays at m_c's vigil long after the rest of the Clan has returned to their nests.
r_c can't imagine going on living without m_c.
r_c presses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} muzzle to m_c's fur one last time, wishing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had another chance to tell m_c how loved {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is}.
The world seems hollow without m_c. r_c struggles through the vigil.
r_c takes a moment of silence at m_c's vigil to bid {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} love farewell.
r_c speaks at length at m_c's vigil, recounting all of their good memories and the qualities that made r_c love {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
Life without m_c seems impossible to r_c - how could someone who meant so much to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} be taken away so easily?
r_c stares in disbelief at m_c's body. It never occurred to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} might die first. The thought was too painful to imagine.
r_c goes on and on at m_c's vigil, desperate to make sure {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} remembered and loved even in death.
r_c can hardly get a word out at m_c's vigil. It just hurts too much.
The world seems unimaginably cruel to r_c, now. Without m_c, what's the point?
r_c closes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes and tries to picture m_c as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} in life, happy and healthy.

body: r_c can't believe m_c is dead. r_c though they had their whole lives ahead of them, to grow up, become mates. But instead, m_c was taken away. r_c waits until everyone else has gone ahead of {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, before approaching m_c's body. r_c wails, why did StarClan have to take m_c now?

r_c doesn't want to trouble {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grief. Everyone is hurting after m_c's death. r_c waits until {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} alone, then sits a silent vigil under Silverpelt, holding back {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} wails.
